data.title: Cuestionario Formativo Inglés IV
data.meta_description: examen cuestionario formativo inglés iv choose the correct response: unit how often do you go to the movies? yes, would no, not sometimes, twice month yes, do
data.text:
Choose the correct response:

UNIT 9

A: How o昀琀en do you go to the movies? B: ____ a. Yes, I would b. No, I’m not c. Some琀椀mes, twice a month d. Yes, I do

A: Would you like to go to a movie on Saturday? B:_____ a. Yes, I would b. No, I don’t c. Yes, I am d. Me neither

I work_____ Saturdays a. In b. On c. At d. Of

Jonathan is my father’s brother. He’s my _________. a. sister b. Son c. Brother d. Uncle

Her name _____ Rose a. Is b. Are c. It d. Am

I didn’t feel well yesterday, so I _________ the a昀琀ernoon o昀昀. a. Did b. Took c. Make d. Take

A: Do you like soap operas? B:_____ a. Yes, I’d love to. b. Usually every day c. No, I don’t like them. d. I love game shows

My brother is______ his twen琀椀es and goes to college in California. a. In b. About c. At d. On

Jackie _______ long curly red hair and green eyes.

a. Does b. Has c. Is d. Are 10. Jun’s uncle __6 feet tall and has a light brown beard and a mustache a. Is b. Has c. Aren’t d. Are 11. How tall is she? a. She is medium height b. She has a ponytail c. She has brown eyes d. She is middle-age 12. I’m going to the grocery store to buy some. a. Food b. Clothes c. Gas d. Pills 13. How long is her hair? a. It’s pre琀琀y short b. She’s about 22. c. She’s 1 meter 60. 14. Who is Joe? a. He’s the man wearing a black cap b. He`s the man wears a black cap c. He’s the man to wear a black cap 15. Who are your parents? a. They are the people in front of you. b. She is the woman wearing a dress. c. He is the one talking to me. 16. What does she look like? a. She is tall with green eyes. b. She is friendly c. She is talka琀椀ve.

UNIT 10

She has lived in Barcelona _______ 2001 a. Since b. For c. In d. On

I ______ hard yesterday a. Study b. Studied

a. Yes, they have b. Yes, They did c. Yes, they do d. Yes, they are

UNIT 11

Some parts of our city are dangerous. It is not ____ at night. a. Hot b. Safe c. Interes琀椀ng d. Beau琀椀ful

Our city is somewhat ugly, _______ it has some beau琀椀ful old homes. a. And b. But c. However d. Though

New York city is very exci琀椀ng, but it’s __________, too. a. Boring b. Interes琀椀ng c. Stressful d. Funny

It’s an amazing beach, ____ I love to go there. a. And b. But c. However d. Though

I ____ decide where to go on vaca琀椀on. ______ I go to NYC or LA? a. Can’t – Should b. Can – shouldn’t c. Can’t – Shouldn’t d. Can – should

My city is a great place to visit. Don’t come in summer, ______. a. And b. But c. However d. Though

Prices are high in Singapore. Everything is very _______. a. Cheap b. Expensive c. Noisy d. Boring

Mumbai is _____ exci琀椀ng place to visit. a. A b. An c. Very d. More

I ____ swim very well.

a. Can b. Should c. Can’t d. Shouldn’t 38. Punta Cana is _____ nice a. More b. Really c. A d. An 39. Mexico DF is one of the most visited ci琀椀es. It has a lot ____ places. a. Boring b. Stressful c. Ugly d. Interes琀椀ng 40. You should not walk alone at nights in Madrid. It’s very _______. a. Noisy b. Crowded c. Quiet d. Dangerous

UNIT 12

It’s important _______ the language everyday. a. To prac琀椀ce b. Prac琀椀ce c. Prac琀椀cing d. Prac琀椀ced

I have ____. I should take an aspirin. a. The 昀氀u b. A stomachache c. A toothache d. A headache

A: Could I have something for insomnia? B: ___ a. Thank you, I do b. Ok. I’ll take it c. Try this herbal tea d. Sleep well.

Kim went to a drugstore yesterday and bought a _____ of pain medicine a. bo琀琀le b. Can c. Tube d. Box

c. Neither do I. d. Neither can I.

I really like Chinese food. a. Really? I can’t. b. Neither am I. c. I do, too. d. Neither can I.

I’m not in the mood for chicken. a. I’m not, either. b. I am, too. c. Oh, I can’t. d. Neither do I.

What ... you like to eat? a. will b. would c. ‘ll d. I’d

Anything to drink? a. Some water, please. b. A hamburger, please. c. Some tuna, please. d. A hot dog, please.

I love fruits. ... are my favorite. a. bread b. chicken c. corn d. grapes

Chicken, beef, lamb and turkey belong to the ... category. a. fruits b. vegetables c. meat d. seafood

Healthy food is tasty and good for you. You need it to grow and feel good. You can 昀椀nd grains in bread and rice. Milk, cheese and yogurt are also important. These will give you strong bones. Meat, eggs, 昀椀sh

and nuts give you protein. Fruits and vegetables are good to eat. Eat as many as you can every day. Chips and cookies are tasty, but eat only some at a 琀椀me. When you eat healthy food, your body will thank

you!

a. give you strong bones. b. give you protein. c. is tasty. d. chips and cookies.

Read and choose the correct answer:

The 琀椀ny island of Singapore has a popula琀椀on of about 5 million people. It also has very strict rules about the way its people behave. Singapore is one of the cleanest ci琀椀es on the planet because of these rules. People are not allowed to chew gum unless it's from a doctor, and all used chewing gum has to go in a trash can. That means that you don't 昀椀nd gum on the sidewalks. In fact, no one drops trash in the street. There are big 昀椀nes for people who don't respect the rules, but most people are happy to keep their city clean and healthy.

In Singapore live more than ... million people.

a. 7

b. 57

c. 5

d. 9

Read and choose the correct answer:

That means that you don't 昀椀nd gum on the sidewalks. In fact, no one drops trash in the street. There are big 昀椀nes for people who don't respect the rules, but most people are happy to keep their city clean and healthy.

People in Singapore have to follow a lot of ...

a. animals

b. rules

c. diets

d. youtubers

Read and choose the correct answer:

We all know that air pollu琀椀on is a problem all around the world, so where do you go if you want really clean air? Well, Cape Grim in Tasmania, Australia is probably the best idea. Cape Grim has some of the cleanest air on Earth. Cape Grim also has beau琀椀ful, clean water. Why is this? Wind! Special winds called "The Roaring For琀椀es“ cross the Southern Ocean, bringing with them wonderfully clean water and air. In fact, in Cape Grim, people are allowed to put rain water into bo琀琀les and sell it. That's how clean it is!

“The Roaring For琀椀es” are...

a. beaches

b. islands

c. valleys

d. winds

A birthday party, a barbecue, a class reunion, and ... are in the category of Friends and family. a. a rock concert b. a 昀椀lm fes琀椀val c. a musical d. a wedding

To thank your friend for an invita琀椀on you can say: a. Sorry, but I already have plans. b. This week is crazy, but let’s shoot for next week. c. Thanks so much for the invite. d. Can I take a rain check.

To apologize and explain why you can’t accept an invita琀椀on, you can say: a. Thanks so much for the invite. b. Thanks so much for asking me. c. Maybe another 琀椀me? I’m free next week. d. Sorry, but I already have plans.

Read and choose the correct answer:

Security cameras in a fancy hotel captured a video of a well-dressed woman, about 30 years old, tex琀椀ng on her phone. There's nothing unusual about that, is there? Well, yes, this 琀椀me there is. The woman was so busy on her phone that she walked right into a pool of water in the hotel lobby ... fully dressed! Nobody knows who the woman is or where the watery adventure happened, but almost half a million people have watched the video on the Internet!

The woman walked into a pool of water because she was ...

a. tex琀椀ng on her phone

b. calling someone

c. driving

d. talking to her husband

a. security guards

c. security cameras

A New Yorker was riding the subway home from work one evening. He was very excited by the video game he was playing on his smartphone. When he won the game, he threw his arms in the air in excitement. At that moment, the subway doors opened to let people on and o昀昀 the train. The problem is that the man threw his phone right out of the subway car and on to the tracks below. Oops! No more video games for a while!

The man got too excited because... a. he lost the game b. he won the game c. people got on the train d. the train stopped

Boyan Slat has one huge goal. It's a goal that could bene昀椀t people and animals all over the world. Amazingly, it looks like he's going to accomplish it.

When he was 16, Dutch engineering student Boyan Slat was on vaca琀椀on in Greece, and he started to think about all the garbage that gets washed up on beaches. The oceans around the world are full of plas琀椀c - millions of tons of plas琀椀c. Unfortunately, plas琀椀c doesn't just disappear. It takes centuries to break down. Slat wanted to do something to change all that. So he made it a personal goal to clean up the garbage in the world's oceans.

Boyan started to think about helping the planet when he was...

a. working.

b. on vaca琀椀on.

c. doing an experiment.

d. presen琀椀ng his project.

Read and choose the correct answer:

Boyan Slat has one huge goal. It's a goal that could bene昀椀t people and animals all over the world. Amazingly, it looks like he's going to accomplish it.

When he was 16, Dutch engineering student Boyan Slat was on vaca琀椀on in Greece, and he started to think about all the garbage that gets washed up on beaches. The oceans around the world are full of plas琀椀c - millions of tons of plas琀椀c. Unfortunately, plas琀椀c doesn't just disappear. It takes centuries to break down. Slat wanted to do something to change all that. So he made it a personal goal to clean up the garbage in the world's oceans.

Boyan’s goal is to ... the garbage in the oceans.

a. sell

b. recycle

c. clean up

d. classify

Read and choose the correct answer:

Slat started with an idea for an extraordinary machine to catch the plas琀椀c 昀氀oa琀椀ng in the water using the natural energy of the ocean. He le昀琀 school in 2013 to begin work on his project, which he called The Ocean Cleanup.

A year later he was leading a team of 100 scien琀椀sts and engineers working on the inven琀椀on. Slat needed money for this, so he started asking people to donate to his project online and raised over $2 million.

Soon a昀琀er. Slat was named a "Champion of the Earth" by the United Na琀椀ons. It's the most important 琀椀tle the UN gives to people helping the environment. The Ocean Cleanup also won several awards for having one of the best inven琀椀ons of 2015. But the dream goes on for Boyan Slat. He hopes that the oceans will be free of plas琀椀c in about twenty or thirty years.

Slat wanted to use ... to remove the plas琀椀c.

a. solar energy

b. robots

c. the natural energy of the ocean

d. people

Read and choose the correct answer:

Slat started with an idea for an extraordinary machine to catch the plas琀椀c 昀氀oa琀椀ng in the water using the natural energy of the ocean. He le昀琀 school in 2013 to begin work on his project, which he called The Ocean Cleanup.

A year later he was leading a team of 100 scien琀椀sts and engineers working on the inven琀椀on. Slat needed money for this, so he started asking people to donate to his project online and raised over $2 million.

Soon a昀琀er. Slat was named a "Champion of the Earth" by the United Na琀椀ons. It's the most important 琀椀tle the UN gives to people helping the environment. The Ocean Cleanup also won several awards for having one of the best inven琀椀ons of 2015. But the dream goes on for Boyan Slat. He hopes that the oceans will be free of plas琀椀c in about twenty or thirty years.

The name of Slat’s project was...

a. The Great Ocean.

b. The Best Ocean.

c. The Crystal Ocean.
